title: How to Open Your Third Eye Chakra with Meditation

steps.title: The third eye is the energy center located at the center of your forehead.
steps.content: The third eye is the energy center located at the center of your forehead. Also known as the inner eye or ajna chakra, this powerful source gives you the ability to see and sense spiritual energies. It’s one of the 7 chakras and represents intelligence, concentration, and awareness. [1] X Research source Trataka (third eye meditation) is one of the best ways to activate and open the third eye because it allows you to slow down your thoughts and open your mind to new possibilities. The third eye is said to sit on the pineal gland in the brain and is the sight of the sixth sense, establishing your mind-body connection. [2] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source The third eye chakra is associated with the color indigo. From the ground up, the 7 chakras in order are root chakra, sacral chakra, solar plexus chakra, heart chakra, throat chakra, third eye chakra, and crown chakra.

steps.title: Sit down in a quiet location where you won’t be disturbed.
steps.content: Sit down in a quiet location where you won’t be disturbed. Finding a calming and relaxing place to meditate can help your mind clear easily. Make sure there are no distractions in your location. Turn off any TVs and radios, silence your phone, and check that no one else is near. [3] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Meditate outside so the peaceful sounds of nature guide your practice or in a dark, warm room to feel extra cozy. Ultimately, where you meditate doesn’t matter as long as you’re comfortable and aren’t distracted by the space. Some people enjoy meditating in groups or with loved ones. [4] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Consider asking a friend or family member to meditate with you if this would help ease your mind.

steps.title: Cross your legs and rest your hands palm up on your knees.
steps.content: Cross your legs and rest your hands palm up on your knees. For most people, this is the most comfortable meditating position. If this is uncomfortable for you, try lying down on your back with your arms relaxed at your sides in corpse pose. [5] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Try sitting on the edge of a chair or a soft surface, like a pillow or blanket. [6] X Expert Source Soken Graf Certified Meditation Coach Expert Interview. 6 March 2020. Make sure you can breathe in whatever position you choose.

steps.title: Close your eyes and relax your body.
steps.content: Close your eyes and relax your body . Allow your body to settle in the calming space you’ve created. Be mindful of how you feel in this current moment, and push other worries or responsibilities aside. If there are aches in your body, work on relaxing those before you begin. [7] X Research source Mentally scan your body, focusing on one body part at a time. [8] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Feel your body expand and contract with each breath. Listen to how your breath and heartbeat sound.

steps.title: Take 3 deep breaths in and out to begin your practice.
steps.content: Take 3 deep breaths in and out to begin your practice. Breathing is the key to any type of meditation. Focus on how your breath feels as you inhale and exhale. Let it be the only thing you think about. Keep your breaths steady and deep throughout your meditation. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Focus on your third eye while counting down from 100.
steps.content: Focus on your third eye while counting down from 100. Imagine a ball of light glowing around your third eye. This light can be white, indigo, or whatever color you associate with your sixth sense. Keep your eyes closed and bring them up to focus on the space between your eyebrows. Begin counting backward from 100. [10] X Research source You may feel a slight strain in your eyes, and that’s completely normal. If the sensation is too much, try counting down from a smaller number and working your way to 100.

steps.title: Bring yourself out of the meditation slowly.
steps.content: Bring yourself out of the meditation slowly. Once you’ve reached 0 in your counting, move your eyes away from the third eye and return your focus to your inhales and exhales. Take 2 to 3 deep breaths before opening your eyes. Blink a few times to readjust to your surroundings, and notice how you feel. [11] X Research source If you feel relaxed but more aware of the energy around you when you open your eyes, you’ve activated your third eye. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Affirmations can help you focus and open the third eye.
steps.content: Affirmations can help you focus and open the third eye. These encouraging phrases or words can empower your mind, body, and spirit and bring energy to a specific area. Try whispering one or two of these affirmations to yourself throughout the day or while meditating to activate your third eye chakra: [13] X Research source I am wise and connected to my inner voice. I open myself to new possibilities and experiences. I honor my truth and follow it gracefully. I trust myself and my higher power. I have everything I need to succeed.

steps.title: If the third eye is open, you’ll feel more aware.
steps.content: If the third eye is open, you’ll feel more aware. Your perception will expand past your physical self, allowing your spiritual energy to explore. You’ll trust your decisions and believe your intuition is guiding you down the right path. If you're creative, you may find yourself inspired by the most unlikely of things or getting the urge to start a new project.

steps.title: If the third eye is blocked, you’ll struggle to concentrate.
steps.content: If the third eye is blocked, you’ll struggle to concentrate. The third eye chakra controls your judgment and focus. When this chakra is imbalanced, it may be harder to make quick decisions and could doubt yourself. You might also find yourself over-indulging in fantasy or daydreaming more often, as you don’t feel as connected to the physical world. Third eye meditation and Hatha yoga can help you realign, balance, and open your third eye by helping you focus on positive energies.
